title.narrative: Mozambique Mining and Gas Technical Assistance Project

description.narrative: The proposed project development objective is to strengthen the capacity and governance systems of key institutions to manage the mining and hydrocarbon sectors in Mozambique.

provider-org.narrative: Mozambique Mining and Gas Technical Assistance Project

title.narrative: Local law enforcement and judicial personnel trained on mining law and regulations under the project
Mines and quarries construction projects subject to technical inspections in line with international industry standards
New mining/gas/infrastructure concessionary contracts negotiated, benefitting from developed frameworks and procedures supported bythe project
Mines and quarries construction projects and gas project developments subject to technical inspections in line with international industry standards.
Mining and gas operations subject to annual cost and fiscal audits in compliance with the established fiscal regime
Number of CSO/CBOs trained on transparency monitoring across the extractive sector value chain
Number of studies with specific recommendations completed and adopted to stimulate linkages between mining and gas projects and Mozambican economy
Gas project developments subject to technical inspections in line with international industry standards
Number of studies assessing economic and financial feasibility for development of gas infrastructure carried out
Staff of gas sector management institutions trained through MAGTAP to manage, regulate and monitor gas sector
Number of ASMs who have received targeted training (of which female %)
Gas operations subject to annual cost and fiscal audits in compliance with the established fiscal regime
Mining operations subject to annual tax oversight and fiscal audits in compliance with the established fiscal regime
Annual disclosure of reports on extractive industries revenues and revenue allocation at national level
Provincial Directorates of Mineral Resources equipped & capable to monitor and inspect mining & exploration operations in their jurisdictions
Computerized Environmental and Social Management Information System developed
Health and safety and environmental regulations, including standards and monitoring procedures updated
Mineral Information System upgraded with new geodata for strategic areas
Procedures of tendering and evaluation of mineral assets developed
A regional office in the North has been equipped and is operational to undertake health and safety, and environmental inspections of gas operations
Mining Cadastral database and GIS accessible on-line for public level information
Results of Strategic Environmental and Social Assessment publicly disclosed by GoM in papers and through workshops and public outreach
Sector specific regulations and action plan for local content developed and adopted
Standards & procedures for oil & gas contingency planning & emergency preparations developed
Tools and mechanisms to attract financing for the State participation are in place
Gas project operations subject to regular technical inspections in line with international industry standards.
Mines and quarries operations subject to regular technical inspections in line with international industry standards.
Regular health and safety and environmental monitoring and control inspections to mines and gas projects in line with regulations for compliance and monitoring
ESIA and SIA guidelines published and disseminated for mining (LSM and ASM) and gas (if underway)
Total number of community pilots implemented in extractives areas and lessons learnt made public
Number of pilot CIA data collection and analysis completed and capacity building action plans under implementation
Number of local firms participating in tenders and providing goods and services to gas and mining operations
Number of Artisinal "Mining Passes" issued and number of Small Scale "Mining Certificates" issued in accordance with regulations
Number of blocks surveyed of which publicly disclosed and available
Emergency response procedures for INP developed
Number of sheets mapped of which publicly disclosed and available
SESA Action Plan implementation is tracked continuously by the Recipient with engagement of stakeholders through public consultation process and feedback mechanism
Number of geological blocks surveyed and number of sheets mapped of which publicly disclosed and available

baseline.value: 1 geological block surveyed and zero sheets mapped

title.narrative: Gender-focused strategy specific to mining formulated
Mines and quarries operations and gas project operations subject to regular technical inspections in line with international industry standards.
